title: One killed, four injured in road accidents - Pakistan - DAWN.COM
content:
OKARA: One man was killed and four others sustained injuries in two separate roadside incidents on Sunday.

On Chuchak Road, a speeding bus collided with a motorcycle, injuring rider Kamran, 20, and his pillion passenger. Both were shifted to the Bama Bala Rural Health Centre, where Kamran succumbed to his injuries.

In another incident on GT Road near a wedding hall, a car hit a motorcycle and injured Zaheer, Zulfiqar and Abubakar. Rescue 1122 shifted them to the hospital with multiple injuries.

DRUGS: Police claimed to have recovered 12.320 kilograms of charas in two operations.

A Haveli Lakkha night patrol team intercepted a suspicious man carrying a mini sack on Wasewala Road. Upon search, police found 11 packets of charas weighing 11 kilograms.

The suspect was identified as Anwar Khan, of Islam Nagar, Haveli Lakkha. A case under Section 9-(1) 3E of the Control of Narcotic Substances Act (CNSA) of 1997 was registered on the complaint of Sub-Inspector Muhammad Razzaq.

Separately, the Ravi police team recovered 1.320 kilograms of charas from Sadi Ahmad, of 12/GD, during routine checking near Darbar Bala Pir. A case under Section 9-(1) 3C of the CNSA 1997 was registered.

Published in Dawn, May 5th, 2025
